title: Transcript of media session by SHWF on medical fees and charges
content_text:
p>
Following is the transcript (English portion) of a media session by the 
Secretary for Health, Welfare and Food, Dr York Chow, after attending a radio 
programme this morning (April 10): Reporter: (On medical fees increase) Dr Chow: I've mentioned many times before that the subsidy level of Hong Kong's 
medical fees and charges is always on the high side, perhaps the highest in the 
world. It gives patients a wrong sense of value, particularly in some of the 
services. It is apparent that a number of patients prefer to have repeated

services. It is apparent that a number of patients prefer to have repeated 
consultations, mainly because it is very cheap. Secondly, they may ask for 
medications that sometimes they don��t need mainly because the charges are so 
low. So these are the important problems that we need to face. We want to make 
sure that the resources given to the public health system are targeted towards 
the really needy. In that aspect, I think the Hospital Authority had looked at 
the affordability and also some of appropriateness of care studies within last

the affordability and also some of appropriateness of care studies within last 
year. Perhaps that is the reason why chairman Mr Anthony Wu mentioned about the 
increase of fees and charges recently. But we need to look at the 
recommendations on the increase in our investment in the health area in the 
future and where the money will come from and how we can put it out in stages so 
that people can have a more thorough understanding about it. If you talk to 
people now that we need to increase investment, of course, most of us, including
people now that we need to increase investment, of course, most of us, including myself, will not give any more money. (Please also refer to the Chinese portion of the transcript)
